com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit
Class ThreadManager

java.lang.Object
  com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.ThreadManager

public class ThreadManager
extends Object

INTERNAL API - SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT ANY TIME - USE AT YOUR OWN RISK.

This is a class that provides thread handling services to internal clients, as well as exposing some of the status of these threads to a public API.

This thread manager class is guaranteed not to keep old windows in memory (no window memory leaks).

Version:
$Revision: 1.1 $
Author:
Brad Clarke, Marc Guillemot, Daniel Gredler
See Also:
MemoryLeakTest

Method Detail

activeCount

public int activeCount()
Returns:
the number of tracked threads

startThread

public int startThread(Runnable job,
                       String label)
INTERNAL API - SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT ANY TIME - USE AT YOUR OWN RISK.
Starts a new job on a background thread. Threads started by this method are always considered daemon threads and will not prevent the JVM from shutting down. For our purposes the JUnit test is the only thread that matters and the background threads are just there to keep the HtmlUnit objects as up to date as possible.

Parameters:
job - the job to start
label - a job description
Returns:
the ID of the new thread, suitable for use in JavaScript and required when calling stopThread(int)

stopThread

public void stopThread(int threadID)
INTERNAL API - SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT ANY TIME - USE AT YOUR OWN RISK.
Stops a thread that was started in this thread manager. Note: this does not immediately stop the thread, only interrupt it and remove it from being tracked by this manager. The thread is responsible for handling being interrupted properly and shutting itself down.

Parameters:
threadID - the ID of the thread to stop

removeJob

public void removeJob(int id)
INTERNAL API - SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT ANY TIME - USE AT YOUR OWN RISK.
Removes the job with the given id for schedule.

Parameters:
id - the ID of the job to remove

joinAll

public boolean joinAll(long maxWaitMillis)
Wait for any executing background threads to complete.

Parameters:
maxWaitMillis - the maximum time that should be waited, in milliseconds This is not an exact time but will be fairly close.
Returns:
true if all threads expired in the specified time

interruptAll

public void interruptAll()
INTERNAL API - SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT ANY TIME - USE AT YOUR OWN RISK.
Attempts to stop running threads.

registerJob

public int registerJob(Object codeToExec,
                       int timeout,
                       String description)
INTERNAL API - SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT ANY TIME - USE AT YOUR OWN RISK.
Registers a JavaScript code to be executed at the given time.

Parameters:
codeToExec - the string or function to execute
timeout - the time to wait before to executed the code
description - the job description
Returns:
the ID of the registered job, suitable for use in JavaScript and required when calling removeJob(int)

public int registerRecurringJob(Object codeToExec,
                                int interval,

INTERNAL API - SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT ANY TIME - USE AT YOUR OWN RISK.
Registers a JavaScript code to be executed at the given intervals.

Parameters:
codeToExec - the string or function to execute
interval - the time to wait between two executions
description - the job description
Returns:
the ID of the registered job, suitable for use in JavaScript and required when calling removeJob(int)
